snippet: Bo Xilai’s talents were counterbalanced by what friends and critics alike say was an insatiable ambition and studied indifference to the wrecked lives that littered his path to power.
abstract: Fall of Bo Xilai, who was widely seen as on his way to a top position in the Chinese government, is said by some experts on Chinese politics to be attributable to his ruthlessness in acquiring power; Bo's rise was marked by a insatiable ambition and a studied indifference to the wrecked lives that littered his path to power.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sharon LaFraniere, Jonathan Ansfield and Ian Johnson from Beijing, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Edy Yin, Li Bibo, Mia Li and Shi Da contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Bo Xilai’s talents were counterbalanced by what friends and critics alike say was an insatiable ambition and studied indifference to the wrecked lives that littered his path to power.

headline.seo: Bo Xilai Was Long Known in China for Ruthlessness
headline.main: In Rise and Fall of China’s Bo Xilai, an Arc of Ruthlessness
headline.print_headline: In Rise And Fall Of Chinese Boss, A Ruthless Arc
